p: Foeniculum vulgare Mill. (fennel) is a biennial medicinal plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. The essential oil of fennel is used as flavoring agents in food products. The main components of fennel essential oil are trans-anethole, fenchone, and estragole [ 13, 14, 15]; among them, trans-anethole exhibits both antioxidants and antimicrobial activities [ 16]. In addition, Patra et al. [ 17] reported that anethole and its isomers are responsible for the antimicrobial activities of fennel oil.
